title: Peter Hurley Photography - WPPI 2013 Medusa Lighting Demo
summary: A promotional showcase from WPPI 2013 featuring photographer Peter Hurley demonstrating the setup and workflow of his 'Medusa' continuous lighting system for capturing high-quality headshots.

steps.action: Introduction to the event at WPPI 2013.
Assemble the lighting rig by attaching strip lights to the custom frame.
Mount the lighting grid onto a stand and adjust the height and angle.
Position subjects in front of a white background, facing the lighting rig.
Shoot through the central opening of the lighting grid to achieve shadowless illumination.
Coach and interact with subjects to elicit genuine smiles and expressions.
Utilize the Medusa Professional Lighting System for consistent, high-key results.

key_takeaways: The Medusa lighting system uses a square arrangement of continuous strip lights to simulate window light.
Shooting through the center of the light source provides flat, flattering lighting for headshots.
Active coaching and photographer interaction are essential for capturing dynamic expressions.
